channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: A new IKEA location received a record-breaking 3,730 applications for just 150 open roles. Inside the pay and perks luring talent back to retail
item.description: IKEA’s new location in London offers employees livable wages, flexible schedules, and other perks.

item.title: Trump’s Ultimatum to Hamas, and Showdown Looms Between White House and the Courts

item.title: Israel’s Security Cabinet Meets as Pressure on Hamas Cease-Fire Rises

item.title: Gaza Cease-Fire Deal’s Long-Term Future Is Bleak, Analysts Say
item.description: Hamas and President Trump have threatened to upend the cease-fire. Analysts say those comments could prove hollow, but the deal still may not last bey...

item.title: Trump blasts WFH policies: ‘Nobody is gonna work from home. They are gonna be going out, playing tennis, playing golf’
item.description: President Donald Trump claims federal employees working from home are playing golf, working 10% of the time and taking on second jobs.

item.title: More Than 150 World War II Practice Bombs Found at Playground in England
item.description: The devices found during construction work were practice bombs, which can be harmful. Officials said there could be more.

item.title: Can European ‘Boots on the Ground’ Help Protect Ukraine’s Security?

item.title: BYD expands ‘God’s Eye’ intelligent driving into its entry level cars, sending other China EV shares tumbling
item.description: Shares of competitors Li Auto, Xpeng, and Geely Auto fell by 6%, 9% and 10% respectively.

item.title: Jordan’s King Faces a Bind as He Meets With Trump

item.title: How Trump’s Canadian Oil Tariff Would Hit U.S. Refineries
item.description: The 10 percent tariff the president said he might impose in March could cause U.S. refineries to cut production and lead to higher prices.
